mng: to grow, to plant, to insert, to force on sb, to fall head first

exm.mng: to grow, to plant, to insert, to force on sb, to fall head first
to grow, to cultivate, to train, to educate, to patronize
growing plants in pots, Japanese: bonsai
to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
to fall head over heels, (fig.) to come a cropper
to enjoy the benefits of the hard work of one's predecessors. (idiom)
exm.pyn: qián rén zāi shù , hòu rén chéng liáng

exm.mng: to fall headlong, fig. a disastrous setback
talk nicely and avoid disputes, give compliments and not remarks
exm.pyn: duō zāi huā shǎo zāi cì

exm.cur: 有意栽花花不发，无心插柳柳成阴
exm.trd: 有意栽花花不發，無心插柳柳成陰
exm.mng: lit. you plant a garden and the flowers do not bloom, you poke a stick in the mud and it grows into a tree, fig. things do not always turn out as one would expect, well-laid plans may fail, and success may come where you least expect it
exm.pyn: yǒu yì zāi huā huā bù fā , wú xīn chā liǔ liǔ chéng yīn

exm.mng: to plunge into, to run headlong into
to enjoy the benefits of the hard work of one's predecessors. (idiom)
exm.pyn: qián rén zāi shù , hòu rén chéng liáng

exm.mng: to tumble, to fall head over heels, (fig.) to take a tumble
